name: OciApplicationLoadBalancer
description:
OciApplicationLoadBalancer is the top-level resource representing an Oracle Cloud
 Infrastructure Application Load Balancer (Layer 7).

fields.name: CompartmentId
fields.description: OCID of the compartment where the load balancer will be created.

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description:
Human-readable name for the load balancer shown in the OCI Console.
 Falls back to metadata.name if not provided.

fields.name: Shape
fields.description:
Load balancer shape. Use "flexible" for configurable bandwidth (recommended).
 Deprecated fixed shapes ("100Mbps", "400Mbps", "8000Mbps") are accepted
 for backward compatibility.

fields.name: ShapeDetails
fields.description:
Bandwidth configuration for flexible-shape load balancers.
 Required when shape is "flexible". Ignored for fixed shapes.

fields.name: SubnetIds
fields.description:
OCIDs of subnets where the load balancer will be provisioned.
 At least one subnet is required. For regional (recommended) load balancers,
 provide subnets in two different availability domains for high availability.
 Changing subnets after creation forces load balancer recreation.

fields.name: IsPrivate
fields.description:
When true, creates a private load balancer that is not accessible from
 the public internet. Private load balancers receive only private IP
 addresses from the assigned subnets.
 Changing this after creation forces load balancer recreation.

fields.name: NetworkSecurityGroupIds
fields.description: OCIDs of network security groups applied to the load balancer.

fields.name: IsDeleteProtectionEnabled
fields.description:
When true, prevents accidental deletion of the load balancer.
 The protection must be explicitly disabled before the load balancer
 can be deleted.

fields.name: IpMode
fields.description:
IP version mode for the load balancer. Accepted values: "IPV4", "IPV6".
 When omitted, defaults to "IPV4".

fields.name: ReservedIps
fields.description:
Pre-created reserved public IPs to assign to the load balancer.
 When omitted, OCI assigns ephemeral public IPs.

fields.name: IsRequestIdEnabled
fields.description:
When true, the load balancer adds a request ID header to each request
 for tracing and debugging purposes.

fields.name: RequestIdHeader
fields.description:
Custom header name for the request ID. Only effective when
 is_request_id_enabled is true. When omitted, OCI uses a default header.

fields.name: BackendSets
fields.description:
Backend sets define groups of backend servers with load balancing
 policies and health checking. At least one backend set is required.
 Each listener routes traffic to exactly one default backend set.

fields.name: Listeners
fields.description:
Listeners define the ports and protocols on which the load balancer
 accepts client connections. At least one listener is required.

fields.name: Certificates
fields.description:
TLS/SSL certificates for HTTPS termination. Certificates are referenced
 by name in listener and backend set SSL configurations.

fields.name: Hostnames
fields.description:
Virtual hostnames for host-based routing. Hostnames are referenced
 by name in listener configurations to route requests based on the
 HTTP Host header.

fields.name: RuleSets
fields.description:
Rule sets for advanced request/response manipulation. Rule sets are
 referenced by name in listener configurations.

nestedTypes.name: Backend
nestedTypes.description:
Backend represents an individual server that receives traffic from
 the load balancer through a backend set.

fields.name: IpAddress
fields.description: IP address of the backend server.

fields.name: Port
fields.description: Port on which the backend server listens for traffic.

fields.name: Weight
fields.description:
Relative weight for traffic distribution. Higher weights receive
 proportionally more traffic. When omitted, defaults to 1.

fields.name: Backup
fields.description:
When true, this backend only receives traffic when all non-backup
 backends are unhealthy.

fields.name: Drain
fields.description:
When true, the backend is in drain mode -- existing connections
 complete but no new connections are sent to this backend.

fields.name: Offline
fields.description:
When true, the backend is temporarily taken offline. No traffic
 is sent to offline backends.

fields.name: MaxConnections
fields.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous connections to this backend.
 When omitted, the backend set's backend_max_connections applies.

nestedTypes.name: BackendSet
nestedTypes.description:
BackendSet defines a group of backend servers that receive traffic
 from the load balancer, along with the load balancing policy and
 health checking configuration.

fields.name: Name
fields.description:
Unique name for this backend set within the load balancer.
 Listeners reference backend sets by this name.

fields.name: Policy
fields.description:
Load balancing policy that determines how traffic is distributed
 across backends.

fields.name: HealthChecker
fields.description:
Health checker configuration that monitors backend availability.
 The load balancer removes unhealthy backends from the rotation
 until they pass health checks again.

fields.name: Backends
fields.description:
Backend servers in this set. When omitted, the backend set is
 created without backends (useful when backends are added dynamically).

fields.name: SslConfiguration
fields.description:
SSL configuration for encrypting traffic between the load balancer
 and the backend servers (backend SSL / re-encryption).

fields.name: BackendMaxConnections
fields.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous connections to allow per backend.
 When omitted, connections are unlimited.

fields.name: LbCookieSessionPersistence
fields.description:
Load-balancer-managed cookie persistence. The LB injects and tracks
 a cookie to pin clients to specific backends.

fields.name: AppCookieSessionPersistence
fields.description:
Application-managed cookie persistence. The LB reads an existing
 application cookie to determine backend affinity.

nestedTypes.name: Certificate
nestedTypes.description:
Certificate defines a TLS/SSL certificate uploaded to the load balancer.
 Certificates are referenced by name in SSL configurations.

fields.name: CertificateName
fields.description:
Unique name for this certificate within the load balancer.
 SSL configurations reference certificates by this name.

fields.name: CaCertificate
fields.description: PEM-encoded CA certificate chain.

fields.name: PublicCertificate
fields.description: PEM-encoded public certificate.

fields.name: PrivateKey
fields.description: PEM-encoded private key for the certificate. Sensitive.

fields.name: Passphrase
fields.description: Passphrase for an encrypted private key. Sensitive.

nestedTypes.name: ConnectionConfiguration
nestedTypes.description: ConnectionConfiguration controls TCP connection behavior for a listener.

fields.name: IdleTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description:
Maximum idle time in seconds before the load balancer closes the
 connection. Applies to both client-side and backend-side connections.

fields.name: BackendTcpProxyProtocolVersion
fields.description:
Backend TCP proxy protocol version. When set, the load balancer
 prepends proxy protocol headers to backend connections, allowing
 backends to see the original client IP.
 Accepted values: 1 or 2.

nestedTypes.name: HealthChecker
nestedTypes.description:
HealthChecker configures periodic health probes sent to backend servers.
 Backends that fail health checks are temporarily removed from the load
 balancing rotation.

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: Protocol used for health checks.

fields.name: Port
fields.description:
Port on the backend server to probe. When omitted or set to 0,
 the health checker uses the backend's traffic port.

fields.name: UrlPath
fields.description:
URL path for HTTP health checks (e.g., "/health", "/ready").
 Required when protocol is http. Ignored for tcp.

fields.name: ReturnCode
fields.description:
Expected HTTP status code from healthy backends (e.g., 200).
 When omitted, any 2xx status is considered healthy.

fields.name: ResponseBodyRegex
fields.description:
Regex pattern to match against the response body. The backend is
 considered healthy only if the response body matches this pattern.
 When omitted, body content is not checked.

fields.name: IntervalMs
fields.description:
Interval between consecutive health checks in milliseconds.
 When omitted, defaults to 30000 (30 seconds).

fields.name: TimeoutInMillis
fields.description:
Maximum time to wait for a health check response in milliseconds.
 When omitted, defaults to 3000 (3 seconds).

fields.name: Retries
fields.description:
Number of consecutive failed health checks before marking a backend
 as unhealthy. When omitted, defaults to 3.

fields.name: IsForcePlainText
fields.description:
When true, forces health checks over plain text even when the
 backend set has SSL configured.

nestedTypes.name: Hostname
nestedTypes.description:
Hostname defines a virtual hostname for host-based routing.
 Listeners reference hostnames by name to restrict which requests
 they handle based on the HTTP Host header.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Unique name for this hostname resource within the load balancer.

fields.name: Hostname
fields.description:
The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) to match against the
 HTTP Host header. Example: "app.example.com".

nestedTypes.name: IpMaxConnection
nestedTypes.description:
IpMaxConnection defines per-IP connection limits for the
 ip_based_max_connections rule action.

fields.name: IpAddresses
fields.description: IP addresses to apply this connection limit to.

fields.name: MaxConnections
fields.description: Maximum simultaneous connections allowed from these IPs.

nestedTypes.name: LbCookieSessionPersistenceConfig
nestedTypes.description:
LbCookieSessionPersistenceConfig configures session persistence using
 a cookie managed by the load balancer. The LB injects a Set-Cookie
 header to pin client sessions to specific backends.

fields.name: CookieName
fields.description: Name of the cookie. When omitted, OCI generates a default name.

fields.name: DisableFallback
fields.description:
When true, connections from clients without the cookie are rejected
 rather than being assigned to a new backend. Useful for preventing
 session migration.

fields.name: Domain
fields.description:
Domain attribute for the Set-Cookie header.
 When omitted, the cookie applies to the request domain.

fields.name: IsHttpOnly
fields.description: When true, the cookie is marked HttpOnly (not accessible to JavaScript).

fields.name: IsSecure
fields.description: When true, the cookie is marked Secure (only sent over HTTPS).

fields.name: MaxAgeInSeconds
fields.description:
Cookie lifetime in seconds. When omitted or set to 0, the cookie
 is a session cookie (expires when the browser closes).

fields.name: Path
fields.description:
Path attribute for the Set-Cookie header.
 When omitted, defaults to "/".

nestedTypes.name: Listener
nestedTypes.description:
Listener defines a port and protocol on which the load balancer accepts
 incoming client connections and routes them to a backend set.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Unique name for this listener within the load balancer.

fields.name: Port
fields.description: Port on which the listener accepts connections.

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: Protocol for the listener.

fields.name: DefaultBackendSetName
fields.description:
Name of the backend set that receives traffic from this listener.
 Must match a backend set defined in backend_sets.

fields.name: SslConfiguration
fields.description:
SSL configuration for encrypting traffic between clients and
 the load balancer (SSL termination). Required for HTTPS listeners.

fields.name: ConnectionConfiguration
fields.description: Connection configuration for idle timeout and proxy protocol settings.

fields.name: HostnameNames
fields.description:
Names of hostname resources defined in this load balancer's hostnames
 list. When set, the listener only handles requests matching these
 hostnames (virtual host routing).

fields.name: RuleSetNames
fields.description:
Names of rule set resources defined in this load balancer's rule_sets
 list. Rule sets are applied in the order specified.

fields.name: RoutingPolicyName
fields.description:
Name of a routing policy for content-based routing.
 Routing policies are an advanced OCI feature managed outside
 this component.

nestedTypes.name: RedirectUri

fields.name: Protocol
fields.description: Target protocol. Use "{protocol}" to preserve the original.

fields.name: Host
fields.description: Target hostname. Use "{host}" to preserve the original.

fields.name: Port
fields.description: Target port. Use 0 to preserve the original.

fields.name: Path
fields.description: Target path. Use "{path}" to preserve the original.

fields.name: Query
fields.description: Target query string. Use "{query}" to preserve the original.

nestedTypes.name: ReservedIp
nestedTypes.description: ReservedIp references a pre-created OCI reserved public IP.

fields.name: Id
fields.description: OCID of the reserved public IP to assign to the load balancer.

nestedTypes.name: RuleSet
nestedTypes.description:
RuleSet groups one or more rules for request/response manipulation.
 Rule sets are applied to listeners for advanced traffic management
 including HTTP redirects, header manipulation, and access control.

fields.name: Name
fields.description: Unique name for this rule set within the load balancer.

fields.name: Items
fields.description: Rules in this set. At least one rule is required.

nestedTypes.name: RuleSetItem
nestedTypes.description:
RuleSetItem defines a single rule within a rule set. The action field
 determines which other fields are relevant:

   add_http_request_header:          header, value
   add_http_response_header:         header, value
   extend_http_request_header_value: header, prefix, suffix
   extend_http_response_header_value: header, prefix, suffix
   remove_http_request_header:       header
   remove_http_response_header:      header
   redirect:                         redirect_uri, response_code, conditions
   allow:                            conditions
   control_access_using_http_methods: allowed_methods, status_code
   http_header:                      are_invalid_characters_allowed,
                                     http_large_header_size_in_kb
   ip_based_max_connections:         default_max_connections, ip_max_connections

fields.name: Action
fields.description: The type of rule. Determines which fields are applicable.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: HTTP header name. Used by header add/remove/extend actions.

fields.name: Value
fields.description:
Header value. Used by add_http_request_header and
 add_http_response_header actions.

fields.name: Prefix
fields.description:
Prefix to prepend to an existing header value.
 Used by extend_http_request_header_value and
 extend_http_response_header_value actions.

fields.name: Suffix
fields.description:
Suffix to append to an existing header value.
 Used by extend_http_request_header_value and
 extend_http_response_header_value actions.

fields.name: RedirectUri
fields.description: Redirect URI template. Used by the redirect action.

fields.name: ResponseCode
fields.description:
HTTP response code for the redirect (e.g., 301, 302, 307, 308).
 Used by the redirect action.

fields.name: Conditions
fields.description:
Conditions that must be met for this rule to apply.
 Used by redirect and allow actions.

fields.name: AllowedMethods
fields.description:
Allowed HTTP methods. Requests using other methods receive the
 status_code response. Used by control_access_using_http_methods.

fields.name: StatusCode
fields.description:
HTTP status code returned when access is denied (e.g., 403, 405).
 Used by control_access_using_http_methods.

fields.name: AreInvalidCharactersAllowed
fields.description:
When true, allows invalid characters in HTTP headers.
 Used by the http_header action.

fields.name: HttpLargeHeaderSizeInKb
fields.description:
Maximum HTTP header size in KB.
 Used by the http_header action.

fields.name: DefaultMaxConnections
fields.description:
Default maximum connections per IP when no specific IP rule matches.
 Used by ip_based_max_connections.

fields.name: IpMaxConnections
fields.description:
Per-IP connection limits.
 Used by ip_based_max_connections.

fields.name: Description
fields.description: Description of the rule.

nestedTypes.name: RuleSetItemCondition
nestedTypes.description: RuleSetItemCondition defines a condition for conditional rule application.

fields.name: AttributeName
fields.description:
Attribute to evaluate. Accepted values:
   "PATH", "SOURCE_IP_ADDRESS", "SOURCE_VCN_ID", "SOURCE_VCN_IP_ADDRESS".

fields.name: AttributeValue
fields.description: Value to match against the attribute.

fields.name: Operator
fields.description:
Matching operator. Accepted values:
   "EXACT_MATCH", "FORCE_LONGEST_PREFIX_MATCH", "PREFIX_MATCH", "SUFFIX_MATCH".
 When omitted, defaults to "EXACT_MATCH".

nestedTypes.name: SessionPersistenceConfig
nestedTypes.description:
SessionPersistenceConfig configures session persistence using an
 existing cookie managed by the backend application. The load balancer
 reads this cookie to determine backend affinity.

fields.name: CookieName
fields.description: Name of the application cookie used for session affinity.

fields.name: DisableFallback
fields.description:
When true, connections from clients without the cookie are rejected
 rather than being assigned to a new backend.

nestedTypes.name: ShapeDetails
nestedTypes.description: ShapeDetails configures bandwidth for flexible-shape load balancers.

fields.name: MinimumBandwidthInMbps
fields.description:
Minimum bandwidth in Mbps. The load balancer always provides at least
 this bandwidth. Valid range: 10-8000.

fields.name: MaximumBandwidthInMbps
fields.description:
Maximum bandwidth in Mbps. The load balancer can burst up to this
 bandwidth. Must be >= minimum_bandwidth_in_mbps. Valid range: 10-8000.

nestedTypes.name: SslConfiguration
nestedTypes.description:
SslConfiguration controls TLS/SSL settings for encrypted communication.
 Used in both backend sets (backend-facing SSL) and listeners
 (client-facing SSL).

fields.name: CertificateIds
fields.description:
OCIDs of OCI Certificate Service certificates.
 Preferred over certificate_name for certificate lifecycle management.

fields.name: CertificateName
fields.description:
Name of a certificate resource defined in this load balancer's
 certificates list. Use certificate_ids instead for managed certificates.

fields.name: CipherSuiteName
fields.description:
Name of the cipher suite for SSL negotiation.
 Example: "oci-default-ssl-cipher-suite-v1".

fields.name: Protocols
fields.description:
TLS protocol versions to accept.
 Example: ["TLSv1.2", "TLSv1.3"].

fields.name: ServerOrderPreference
fields.description:
Server cipher order preference. Accepted values:
 "ENABLED" (server preference) or "DISABLED" (client preference).

fields.name: TrustedCertificateAuthorityIds
fields.description:
OCIDs of trusted CA certificates for verifying backend server
 certificates (backend SSL) or client certificates (mutual TLS).

fields.name: VerifyDepth
fields.description:
Maximum depth for certificate chain verification.
 When omitted, defaults to 5.

fields.name: VerifyPeerCertificate
fields.description:
When true, the load balancer verifies the peer's certificate.
 For backend SSL: verifies the backend server certificate.
 For listener SSL with mutual TLS: verifies the client certificate.

fields.name: HasSessionResumption
fields.description:
When true, enables TLS session resumption for improved performance.
 Only applicable in listener SSL context. Ignored for backend set SSL.
